org.jacp.api.componentLayout
Interface IPerspectiveLayout<M,B>

Type Parameters:
M - type of root component
B - type of target components
public interface IPerspectiveLayout<M,B>

Defines layout of a perspective and the container for included editors and views (target components); for use in perspectives handle method.

Author:
Andy Moncsek

Method Summary
 M getRootComponent()
          Get the ' layoutwrapper' for perspective; a layout component is a component which can contain UI subcomponents.
 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,B> getTargetLayoutComponents()
          Returns map of target components and ids key - id value - target component.
 void registerRootComponent(M comp)
          Set Layout-Wrapper for perspective; this wrapper contains wrappers for editors and views, define a valid component which is valid to hold subcomponents.
 void registerTargetLayoutComponent(java.lang.String id, B target)
          Register a target component; a target component defines a wrapper where editors and views can "live" in; you can define a target for each editor or view component; create an root component, a complex layout an register all components where editors/views should displayed in.
 

Method Detail

registerRootComponent

void registerRootComponent(M comp)
Set Layout-Wrapper for perspective; this wrapper contains wrappers for editors and views, define a valid component which is valid to hold subcomponents.

Parameters:
comp - the new root component

getRootComponent

M getRootComponent()
Get the ' layoutwrapper' for perspective; a layout component is a component which can contain UI subcomponents.

Returns:
the toolkit root component where all other UI components are included

getTargetLayoutComponents

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,B> getTargetLayoutComponents()
Returns map of target components and ids key - id value - target component.

Returns:
a map with all target UI components

registerTargetLayoutComponent

void registerTargetLayoutComponent(java.lang.String id,
                                   B target)
Register a target component; a target component defines a wrapper where editors and views can "live" in; you can define a target for each editor or view component; create an root component, a complex layout an register all components where editors/views should displayed in.

Parameters:
id - the id
target - the target
